storyInfo: Kjeragandr manifests Herself, commanding the Trilby Asher to leave, who then decides on an alternate method of investigation. At the bonfire banquet, the Trilby Asher delivers his collected intelligence to the Viscount, who returns to the barracks, soon ordering his troops to load live ammunition.

attributes.content: How long do you plan on sitting there?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: He already knows of this place. He will turn up sooner or later.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: And what will you do once he turns up?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Kill him.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Murdering a foreign dignitary is a serious crime, you know.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: We shall see.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Why do you go so far for Kjerag's sake, when you're not from Kjerag yourself?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Is it still considered 'for Kjerag's sake' if it's Enciodes's ambition?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Who can deny that up till now, despite him having his own lofty goals, that there is a part of them that is 'for Kjerag's sake'?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: That sort of praise is probably what he would least like to hear.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: You still haven't answered my question, you know.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: When Enciodes once mentioned to me that perhaps Kjeragandr truly existed, I thought to myself that maybe one day, I could fight those so-called 'gods' with my own two hands.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Now I see that was simply wishful thinking.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: And why is that?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Enciodes had already dropped that particular plan, for one.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: If he had stuck to it, do you think that you could face down a goddess who just might really exist?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Perhaps?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Here, I can only find that sort of excitement during avalanches. If I ever had the opportunity, I would definitely give it a try.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Do you think you will win?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: No. I have stood against the avalanche, but I have never once triumphed.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: I understand. You are simply in it for the challenge.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: And you consider the matters that are happening in this land to be suitable for that purpose.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: It's hardly as lofty as you think. This is just who I have grown to be, nothing more.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Very well said.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: You may head back now, Degenbrecher.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: You will not find your battlefield here.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: If that is what the Saintess wills, then forgive me for being unable to comply.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: I will decide my own battlefield.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: And what if I said that is what Kjeragandr wills?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: I will then wonder, why are you the one conveying Kjeragandr's will?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: I am the Saintess's maid, after all.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: So what you are saying is that the will of the Saintess is the will of Kjeragandr?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Rather, that Kjeragandr supports the Great Saintess's opinion on the matter.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: At least, that is my guess.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: The Black Knight is no fool. Rather than searching all over for me, she will instead be watching over here.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: She knows that I will return, and return I must.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: *sigh* If only I could return home alive.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: If I had only guessed that this place would be the center of my worries—
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: No, how could I have guessed? How could anyone have thought that Enciodes had the brass courage to use an entire nation's faith as a pretense for his own schemes?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: He truly is someone that the Duke was wise to invest in.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: And that Saintess. Is she really not aware of a single matter going on behind the scenes?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: And Degenbrecher?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: She couldn't possibly be quite so single-minded as to have missed the forest for the tree.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: This is... a rock?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Why have you come, traveler from afar?
I am but a man of steadfast faith, here to admire Her visage.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: She tires, and wishes to rest for today.
Come back tomorrow.
I had heard that Kjeragandr welcomes believers from afar. Do you mean to say that this is no longer the case?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The pious need not prove themselves, while the insincere need not waste their words.
You are not to take a step further today, says She.
And if I insist?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Wha—
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The Trilby Asher looks all about him. The main path by Lake Silberneherze is bustling with activity most days, and today is no exception, which is why it causes no small amount of turned heads when he suddenly appears out of nowhere.
Suddenly, he smacked himself in the face hard.
Hey, when did that guy pop up there?
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: Look, he's slapping himself for some reason.
attributes.name: Passerby B

attributes.content: Think he's some kinda lunatic?
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: Haha.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The Trilby Asher takes no note of the people around him, simply turning his body in the direction of the statue of Kjeragandr. In imitation of those devout followers, he performs a quick gesture of prayer.
Kjeragandr's blessings be upon you.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: This was the first time he had done such an act since stepping into this land.
After doing so, he turns to leave without a moment's hesitation.
He had not yet noticed that, from not too far away, there was a pair of eyes watching his every move.
Degenbrecher isn't a very talkative woman, so she probably won't tell Enya about this, would she?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: I don't think I went too far either, did I?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: *sigh* I've said this before, but staying a spectator is harder than it looks.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: She sighs once more then turns, looking every bit like a woman grumbling about the troublesome requests of her younger sister, before blending into the throng of people like she was never there.
Stop right there.
attributes.name: Tschäggättä A

attributes.content: Ah, hello, captain.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: Who're you?
attributes.name: Tschäggättä B

attributes.content: Well, it's like this, see. There's going to be a banquet held by Lake Silberneherze tonight, right?
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: I'm here to deliver the wine.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: Wine?
attributes.name: Tschäggättä A

attributes.content: I had heard the news about that earlier.
attributes.name: Tschäggättä B

attributes.content: Come with me, I'll need to verify this.
attributes.name: Tschäggättä B

attributes.content: Alright, sure.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: Stand over here. Don't move. Pat him down.
attributes.name: Tschäggättä B

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Tschäggättä A

attributes.content: Boys, I'm just trying to drop off some drinks. Do we really need to do this whole song and dance?
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: These are special circumstances. I appreciate your cooperation.
attributes.name: Tschäggättä A

attributes.content: If you really are who you are, we will offer our deepest apologies later.
attributes.name: Tschäggättä A

attributes.content: Ah, I'm afraid that you two won't have the chance to do that.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: Wha—
attributes.name: Tschäggättä A

attributes.content: The vintner presses down on a device hanging at his waist, and the security cameras in the room began to rotate wildly as if possessed.
Guh...
attributes.name: Tschäggättä A

attributes.content: There's an ene—
attributes.name: Tschäggättä B

attributes.content: Nice try.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: Ghaah—
attributes.name: Tschäggättä B

attributes.content: After the two Tschäggättä fall over, the vintner swiftly begins to operate the terminal.
As he meddles with the terminal, the cameras in the corners of the room briefly halt, before returning to their normal activity.
From my earlier investigations, I knew that Kjerag managed to get a previous-gen OS, but it's got two fatal flaws.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: I recommend you upgrade to the latest generation when you can.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: Naturally, if Kjerag were to become a part of Victoria, we would provide one free of charge.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: The vintner breathes a sigh of relief, but then immediately doubles over.
Hfff— Looks like my wounds are about to reopen.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: The destructive power of the Black Knight is no joke.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: But she can hardly be everywhere all at once.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: As for Kjeragandr...
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: I'll worry about that later. At least She didn't prevent me finding this place.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: He stands up again, ambling towards the nearby barrel of wine.
The barrel is heavy, but as he draws close, it is immediately obvious that there is a distinct lack of the scent of wine in the air.
...Haha.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: What was stored inside the barrel was not wine, but metal.
I had investigated the amount of metal Kjerag was procuring, and at the time nobody had any issue with the numbers.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: But if, say, the metal that was to be used in the construction of the statue, was not all put towards that purpose...
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: Where, then, did all that remaining metal go?
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: And where is this metal in the barrels slated to go next?
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: Haha, I said that while the Black Knight's fearsome, she's not so strong as to cut through steel like butter. And I was right.
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: He turns back to operate the terminal once more.
As his fingers unceasingly type away at the keyboard, various charts and diagrams continuously pop up on the screen above him.
After a long, long while, he finally stands up.
Anyways...
attributes.name: Vintner?

attributes.content: There's still a few hours to go to the banquet—
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: So allow me to give a quick inspection, Enciodes.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Are you really so much a fool that you would dare to stand against Victoria?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: So let me get this straight. You saw your father, and then you gave him a kick?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Yep, felt real good!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: I wasn't that angry to begin with. But once I saw that he looked like what I assumed my papa would look like, I had the sudden urge to give him a real big kick.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Haha, atta girl!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Speaking of which, I had the pleasure of meeting Patriarch Arctosz once when I had just arrived to Kjerag, but I haven't seen him since.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: If I had remembered how he had looked, you wouldn't have had to wander around willy-nilly to find him.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hey, are you trying to say that I actually do look a lot like him?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Hmm, well now that I think about it more, thanks to that beard of his... Even if I had been drinking with him yesterday, I don't think it would have been that easy to notice.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I told him already, that bearded look just isn't in these days.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: What if... he shaved it off?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Eh?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Oh, nothing. Don't mind me.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hey, look over there! That's a whole lotta burdenbeasts.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Oh, the villagers from nearby are here too.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'm thinking that this will be a mighty fine night.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Eh?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: There's a burdenbeast bumping its head against you.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Oh!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: If it isn't my lovely Lily!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Haha, that girl ran over the moment she spotted you.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: Good girl, good girl.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hey, dedushka, this is the Lily you were talking about?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Indeed. She was the first burdenbeast I met when I arrived in Kjerag.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: And she has become, dare I say, my dearest friend ever since I arrived.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Oh, aren't you a little cutie-pie!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: (Rough braying)
attributes.name: Lily

attributes.content: Ooo, can I pet her?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: But of course. Lily's an affectionate girl.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: (Affectionate humming)
attributes.name: Lily

attributes.content: I think she likes you.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Haha! Rosalind, it seems you really do have Kjerag blood in you!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Whoa! She's licking me!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Do you want to ride her?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Can I?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: It should be alright, right, Leones?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hahaha, it's alright, kid.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: Alright! Help me up a bit, dedushka!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Okay, grab on to my hand, and a one, two, three—!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: (Excited rumbling)
attributes.name: Lily

attributes.content: Wow, Lily's real steady!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: I think I'll go on a stroll with her!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Go on ahead, now.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Heh, she sure is a lively little kid, now, isn't she?
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: You don't need to tell me. My daughter was the same at her age.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Here, for you.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: This is—
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Some of our best cheese. Just finished ripening today.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: I remembered that you were going back home pretty soon, so I whipped up this block just for you. I'd hoped I would see you tonight, so I brought it along just in case.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: I appreciate the gesture, but are you sure it's alright? Doesn't your family need this cheese to sell?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Oh, think nothing of it. You've helped my family and our burdenbeasts plenty.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: I'd say that I owe you for medical expenses.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: So here, consider this cheese your veterinary fee.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: Haha, alright, if you insist.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Couldn't ask for a better parting gift, if you ask me.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Truth be told, when you first showed up, we were pretty wary of you.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: But after a whole month with you, I feel like we're the best of friends.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: So I'm not going to get too mushy with you. Just remember that the next time you're in Kjerag, we'll always have space at the table for you at my farm.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: I will. I really will.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Ah, Leone, are you acquainted with the Lord Viscount as well?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Ah, Saintess! Yes, Harold here's become a right celebrity here in our little village.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: I see. I hope that you and your burdenbeasts continue to enjoy yourselves.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Oh, please, getting to meet the Saintess is plenty of joy for me already!
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: This banquet sure is festive, Holy Saintess.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Though there will be plenty of pomp and circumstance at the ceremony tomorrow, the populace at large will only be able to watch it via the news cameras.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Which is why I arranged for this banquet, to allow all of Kjerag to enjoy the holiday cheer.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: You truly are a great Saintess.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: May I ask where the Trilby Asher might be?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: He's a bit of a somber fellow, not a great lover of festivities.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I would hardly say that, My Lord.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: While it's true that I'm not a fan of festive crowds, that has hardly anything to do with my personality.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'm afraid that I was observing Kjerag's magnificent scenery and lost track of time. Do forgive me, Holy Saintess.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I am glad to hear that you appreciate Kjerag's natural beauty.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: I hope that you enjoy tonight's banquet just as much.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Indeed I will.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Ah! That's right, Harold, I have some wine here. Does your friend here drink? Come, let's have a cup or two together!
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: The 'Trilby Asher' surreptitiously shares a hand signal with Harold.
It is a military hand signal, indicating withdrawal.
Terribly sorry, Leones.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'm afraid the drink will have to wait.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: (High-pitched braying)
attributes.name: Lily

attributes.content: I'm back, dedushka.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Huh? Where'd he go?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: He got pulled away by his friend in black.
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: 'John'?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: ...No way.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: I do hope that you managed to enjoy yourself at tonight's banquet, My Lord.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I sure was, up until you called me away.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Good, because I do not think you will enjoy this next step.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Out with it.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: There is a secret underneath the Kjeragandr statue at the heart of Lake Silberneherze.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Soldiers really hate the word 'secret', Mr. 'John Smith'. Isn't this your lot's job to figure out these sort of things, rather than ours?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Unfortunately, I have no way of solving this particular issue myself.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Not words I expected to hear out of a Trilby Asher.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I have run into a few obstructions.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Wait, am I hearing you right? You've failed?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Though I am unable to ascertain what exactly is down there, the very fact that I am encountering resistance is proof that I am on the right track.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The Trilby Asher takes out a stack of loose papers from the inner recesses of his coat. Within that stack are photographs, assorted documents and some handwritten notes.
Harold takes a few to look at himself, and immediately, the smile on his face freezes.
Goods loaded onto the wine transport carriages.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The true flow of the oriron supply chain.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Transport route itineraries.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: All this intelligence points towards a single fact—
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Under the island at the heart of the lake lies Enciodes's secret... No, not just his, but the greatest secret of this entire nation.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: ...She's gone.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Allowing the daughter of a Kjerag politician to hear that was not good.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I'm a soldier, I only care about real battles. This is something that you intelligence agents should be handling.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: She barely even knows whose daughter she is. What can she possibly do?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: If this makes her recognize what is brewing in this nation and make her cut her visit early, this is not necessarily a bad thing.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: She is, in the end, merely a citizen of Ursus. I am not one to make an enemy of that empire.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Perhaps I misjudged you during our earlier meet-ups, my good Trilby Asher.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You and me both, My Lord.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Perhaps it is a good thing that people like you and I are wary of one another.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Some real words of wisdom you got there.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: My next words might not be those words of wisdom you so adore.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You cannot go home empty-handed, My Lord.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I hope you truly understand that this is the price Enciodes must pay Her Grace.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: He has crossed a line.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Is that what you tell yourself to make it feel better?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You're far better at that sort of thing than I am.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: O Great Hero.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The banquet continues.
People gathered around the bonfire singing merry tunes and dancing, welcoming the arrival of tomorrow.
In their minds, tomorrow will certainly be a bright, jubilant, festive day, one that would compel anyone to break out into ecstatic dance and vibrant song.
'I'm probably the only one in the room who doesn't feel that way', thought Harold.
He suddenly feels a little chilly.
The last time he felt such a chill was the very first time he set foot in this land.
He felt like what he really needed was a bottle of wine. Perhaps a whole barrel.
Harold! I've been waiting ages for you, *hic*!
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: If you were any later, I would have finished the entire bottle myself!
attributes.name: Old Herdsman

attributes.content: Hahaha, look at me! Do I look like the sort of person to miss out on fine drink?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Come! Tonight, we drink till we drop!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.text: He's forgotten some of the finer details of what he did that night.
Perhaps he danced a merry jig from his hometown by the bonfire? Or perhaps he grabbed some unlucky fellow to sing some folk songs of Kjerag with?
Ah, that's right. He seemed to have spent a good amount of time discussing the finer points of Kjerag veterinary techniques with a guard rail.
How did he get to this point?
Alas, nobody knows.
At the very least, he remembered the way back to his bed.
However, the distance between the banquet and the barracks is no short stroll.

First, he had to follow along the lakeside path until it joined with the main street at the center of town. Along the road, he would run into many elderly folk taking a post-meal walk, and see children playing atop the ice.

From here, he could see the distant statue of Kjeragandr, and all along the road there were viewing stations set up just for gazing upon it. They were bustling places filled with people at all times. Some prayed towards Kjeragandr, while others took selfies.
There are times when two diametrically opposed ways of life will clash, but most times they will coexist in some sort of harmony. Such was the way of many things in this land.

Continuing on, he passed through the main street, which got busier by the day. He distinctly remembered noticing that some of the stores that were there when he first arrived in Kjerag had changed ownership.
In a small alley close to the center of the road, there was the latest restaurant that he had fallen in love with.
This restaurant had managed to meld together the flavors of Victoria and Kjerag together into their dishes, and suffice it to say that he was a big fan.
The restaurant was run by a young couple, the wife a Kjerag native who had learnt the culinary arts in Victoria, meeting her spouse in the process.
The two of them started a family, returning to Kjerag to set up their restaurant, hoping that they would be able to have a better life in this flourishing land.

After the alley, he had to cross a highway still under construction, then a patch of woods, before arriving at the hillside where he could look out over the whole land, where a roaring fireplace awaited him.
At the moment when he stepped over the edge of the road onto the soft soil, he became quite aware of just how much further this nation had to go to be considered 'well-developed'.
But walking through the tranquil woods immediately put a stop to that line of thinking.
Though he often jabbers away with other old men whenever they meet, lately he finds himself thinking back to the time of his youth.
The golden wheat fields rustling in the evening breeze, his younger self running about within as though he were without a care in the world—
Yes, without a single care in the world.
As he walked across the icy ground, as he found himself cloaked in snowy silence, one thought came to the forefront of his mind. He was no longer young.

attributes.content: Whew, you reek of booze.
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: Boss, if you're going out to get roaring drunk, can't you at least bring some back for your boys?
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: Boss, look here!
attributes.name: Sickly Soldier

attributes.content: These damned burdenbeast blind boxes! We've gotten three full sets now except for the mystery variant! This has got to be some kinda scam by Karlan Trade!
attributes.name: Sickly Soldier

attributes.content: He pulls out a remote control from the deepest recesses of his room, constantly flicking through the various slides on a projector.
Every single one has information regarding Kjerag. Possible marching routes, the locations of military bases, the distribution of sentry posts, investigations into the Tschäggättä—
Within a week of him arriving in Kjerag, all this intelligence was already neatly organized before him, and yet again and again he forced himself to stop thinking about these matters.
To the point that he has managed to memorize most of it.
He throws aside the remote control and grabs a collapsible chair close at hand, throwing himself deep into its embrace as he closes his eyes.

Rather than looking at maps and military sand tables, he much prefers listening to the subtle sounds of snow falling on branches, making them rustle and creak under its weight. It reminds him of the sound of waves of wheat—
Rustling under the moonlit breeze—
Boss? What's the matter?
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: Don't mind him, he's probably just drunk off his gourd. Let's get back to what we were talking about just now.
attributes.name: Seasoned Soldier

attributes.content: I heard that the Leithanians want to build a new city, mostly to get foreign trade going. Check out these preferential policies. The calculated returns for investments are unreal...
attributes.name: Seasoned Soldier

attributes.content: But reality never goes the way he wishes it to.
Just like how his father always yelled at him to get out of the wheat field and to continue his training at home.
Just like when his pipe stem loses a piece without him knowing.
Just like how his lost leg would never return.
...*sigh*
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: The hubbub of the barracks fades away, as his men all look towards him.
His men. His lads. His soldiers.
Everyone, change to live ammunition, then be on standby.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: At the break of dawn tomorrow, we begin our operation. Our target is—
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: The statue of Kjeragandr.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: His voice is somewhat hoarse.
The rustling of wheat in the wind has stopped.
